stories.original_headline: Melting Antarctic ice may weaken a major carbon sink
stories.original_summary: Melting ice from West Antarctica once delivered huge amounts of iron to the Southern Ocean, but algae growth did not increase as expected. Researchers found the iron was in a form that marine life could not easily use. This means more melting ice does not automatically boost carbon absorption. In th
stories.fantasy_headline: Southern Ice Unveils Secret of the Dark Humors
stories.fantasy_story: Wizards studying the great Southern Ice Barrier found its melting waters carried much dark earth-metal to the ocean. Yet, the sea moss did not flourish as hoped. They learned the metal was not easily used by deep-sea creatures, meaning the ocean's power to absorb dark humors from the air isn't automatically strengthened by the melting ice.

stories.original_headline: MIT's new brain tool could finally explain consciousness
stories.original_summary: Scientists still don’t know how the brain turns physical activity into thoughts, feelings, and awareness—but a powerful new tool may help crack the mystery. Researchers at MIT are exploring transcranial focused ultrasound, a noninvasive technology that can precisely stimulate deep regions of the bra
stories.fantasy_headline: New Mind-Artifact May Unravel the Secret of Waking Dreams
stories.fantasy_story: The Scholars of the Grey Tower have long wondered how our flesh sparks thought and soul. Now, they've unveiled a cunning new artifact: a focused sound-spell. This device can gently stir the deepest chambers of the mind-orb, offering hope to finally understand the mystery of awareness itself.

stories.original_headline: Valve’s Steam Machine has been delayed, and the RAM crisis will impact pricing
stories.original_summary: When Valve first announced its impressive-looking Steam Machine, Steam Frame, and Steam Controller hardware in November, the company said the products would begin shipping in early 2026. Some journalists were told "Q1 2026" specifically. But because of the ongoing memory and storage crunch, that lau
stories.fantasy_headline: Valve Guild's Marvels Delayed Due to Arcane Component Scarcity
stories.fantasy_story: The Valve Crafting Guild announced its wondrous Steam Golem and Vision Frame would be delayed. They had promised these mechanical marvels by early next year. However, a widespread scarcity of vital arcane components will both postpone delivery and raise the cost in gold coins.

stories.original_headline: Google’s annual revenue tops $400 billion for the first time
stories.original_summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, has earned more than $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time. The company announced the milestone as part of its Q4 2025 earnings report released on Wednesday, which highlights the 15 percent year-over-year increase as its cloud business and YouTube conti
stories.fantasy_headline: Grand Alphabet Guild Achieves Record Gold Haul!
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Alphabet Mercantile Guild announced a truly astounding feat. Their yearly earnings in gold exceeded four hundred million shining gold coins for the first time ever! This grand achievement was thanks to the continued success of their distant sky-scribing services and wondrous crystal-gazing orbs.
